summary: Crowley & Aziraphale for the ask game
question: Crowley & Aziraphale for the ask game
answer:
Crowley:

  • First impression: After just the first few pages, I thought he seemed like a super cool dude
  • Impression now: Huge dumbass energy, this one
  • Favorite moment: It changes all the time, but right now I keep thinking about the graveyard scene and how that should have been where I realized he’s just a dork
  • Idea for a story: Right now…origin story for that damn necklace
  • Unpopular opinion: Crowley is bisexual.
  • Favorite relationship: INEFFABLE HUSBANDSSSSS
  • Favorite headcanon: Crowley is bisexual.

Aziraphale:

  • First impression: standard “English, intelligent, and gay” thing
  • Impression now: English, dumb as fuck, and gay
  • Favorite moment: Possessing all those random people and highkey judging all of them
  • Idea for a story: NECKLACE, also, ya know, I need to get to that requested second chapter of the fem!Aziraphale fic
  • Unpopular opinion: the mean things he says to Crowley (i.e. not being able to comprehend love) probably hurt Crowley’s feelings, even if he doesn’t 100% believe what he says or intend it as hurtful
  • Favorite relationship: IN. EFFABLE. FUCKING. HUSBANDS.
  • Favorite headcanon: He’s incredibly uncomfortable in his human body even though he’s been in if for 6,000+ years give or take, depending on whether or not he’s ever actually been discorporated. That’s why he always sits so stiffly. He didn’t learn that from gentlemanly high society. He just happened to fit in well under the guise of a high society gentleman because of it.

summary: so a whole bunch of reviews of Good Omens came out today (I guess this could be spoiler-y, but there’s nothing specific?) and I...
body:
so a whole bunch of reviews of Good Omens came out today (I guess this could be spoiler-y, but there’s nothing specific?) and I

[Crowley] and Aziraphale have a teasing, love/hate relationship that fans of the book have shipped for almost two decades. Gaiman has since promised that “the TV series gets deeper into Crowley and Aziraphale’s relationship,” and some viewers will be hoping that that will translate into a burgeoning romance.

Certainly in episode one, Aziraphale seems rather overexcited at the prospect of he and Crowley becoming joint “godfathers” to the infant Antichrist…. [x]

am

[T]hey both realize they’ve got some degree of free will and are able, in some small capacity, to live their lives for themselves (and one another). At least, that’s what they believe to be true….

Aziraphale and Crowley’s chemistry with one another is a core component of their characterizations in the book and Tennant and Sheen capture them both brilliantly with just the right blend of genuine tenderness and exasperation. Neither of them directly say it to one another, but Crowley and Aziraphale are more than friends or partners in any mortal sense of the words, they’re the only people in existence who can understand one another and can’t conceive of existing without being connected. [x]

absolutely

Michael Sheen’s portrayal of the angel’s awkward meekness and affection gives the friendship between Aziraphale and Crowley the feeling of a much deeper bond. [x]

fucking

Crowley and Aziraphale have been around forever and share something that might be a little more than friendship…. [x]

incapacitated

Their push-pull dynamic is as playful as it is stealthily romantic, something the show leans into as it becomes clear that their friendship is the heart of the series. [x]

like

[T]he focus on the characters mean it is, at its heart, a love story between these two unlikely companions whose friendship has lasted since the beginning of time. And they aren’t about to allow something as trivial as the oncoming war between heaven and hell break them apart. [x]

help!!!!!

summary: You know how Aziraphale and Crowley find in each other someone who understands them better than anyone else? Although, of...
body:
You know how Aziraphale and Crowley find in each other someone who understands them better than anyone else? Although, of course, neither of them would admit it.

And there’s also the fact that they’re not only friends, but probably the only friend the other has?

Remember how Crowley describes Aziraphale as “The Enemy, of course. But an enemy for six thousand years now, which made him a sort of friend”.

What other friends do they have? Neither has a close relationship with other people from their side. And then there are also humans, but of course, with humans there’s a tendency to die.

Now, imagine having to live an eternity without a friend. An endless life, but no one to share it with.

So, what I’m trying to say here is that, although it is not explicit in the book, what ultimately made them work together was each other. Yes, sushi is important, and so are musicians, and fascinating little restaurants where they know you, and old bookshops, and of course free will. All of the things they would lose if their side won are important, yes. But losing them wouldn’t be as terrible as losing a best friend and the love of their lives.

Thank you for coming to my TedTalk

summary: How to kill your wife - Part 9 – Losing it all
title: How to kill your wife - Part 9 – Losing it all
body:
Summary: When his father makes a deal with his business partner Dean must agree to an arranged marriage. Hating the thought with every fiber of his body he plans to get rid of you.

Pairing: MobsterDean x Reader, John Winchester, Crowley McLeod

Warnings: angst, virgin reader, age gap (the reader is 25, Dean 35), sad reader, scared reader, tears, arranged marriage, protective Dean

How to kill your wife Masterlist

Entering your home, you run straight into your fathers’ arms. Sobbing and shaking you look up at him.

“What happened?” Crowley asks.

“I…I know who kidnapped me. The Styne’s, Jacob and Eldon. I recognized the laughter…the shoes. Daddy, they are at Dean’s house. He talked to them to get rid of me. They are behind all of this. Jessica’s death, Sam’s kidnapping. My misery…those two…It was John and the Styne’s, daddy. We need to…”

Watching your fathers face darken you know you made a mistake coming here.

He’s angry yet mad…but why? As you ran to him looking for a safe haven?

“You are wrong my child. Not the Styne’s and John. Me and the Styne’s. It was my masterplan to get my business back. To regain control over John.”

“What do you mean?”

“I kidnapped Sam and his fiancée. Threatened John to kill the girl and his beloved son. Johnny was stubborn so Jessica paid the price. Eldon and Jacob didn’t even want money. The fun was enough.”

Eyes widen in horror you let your fathers’ words sink in. He was behind all this?

“Those men raped and killed Jessica, daddy. How could you do this to Sam?” You sob.

“It’s the business, my dear. Nothing personal.”

“Why did you let them kidnap me too then? This doesn’t make sense at all.”

“You see the kidnapping was nothing I did with pleasure, but your mother wanted to tell John about my plans, and I had to make sure she shuts her mouth.”

Hearing your fathers’ words, you feel dizzy, nausea wells up your stomach and you have problems to keep yourself upright.

“The marks? Why the marks?” You ask voice trembling now.

“To make your mother see what happens when she tries to disturb my business.” Crowley answers.

“All this for what? Why?”

“To get my business back and to force John agreeing to the contract.”

“The marriage was your idea? Is that the reason John treats my like… oh…god…”

“Well. Don’t worry. Johnny and Dean will be history soon, just like weak little Moose. Then you will marry Eldon and I can take over the family business. You are the only surviving Winchester after all.” Crowley snickers.

“I…should go,” you stammer.

“Into your room. That’s right.” Crowley warns and you nod.

“Okay. Dad. I understand. I’m sorry for causing trouble. I’ll be in my room then.” You say running upstairs.

With shaking hands, you dial Dean’s number to tell him…well everything.

“Y/N? Where are you? What happened?” Dean asks worriedly.

“Just listen. I’m so sorry. The Styne’s I recognized the laughter. They are the kidnappers. It’s not John…it’s my father. He…oh god… I’m so sorry. He was it all the time. My father said he wants to kill John and you to get hold of the business. He wants me to marry Eldon. Tell Sammy I’m so sorry. Crowley did all of this to force your dad to agree to the marriage. I was wrong…so wrong. Please forgive me…I’m…I never hated you, Dean…I liked you…I want you to be happy.” Hearing your father walking toward your room you start crying.

“I hope you can forgive me one day…” You sob.

“Where are you?” Dean asks.

“Home…my room.” You whisper before hiding the phone under your bed sheets.

“You should rest now, daughter. Tomorrow you will meet Eldon to show you can be a good wife to him.” Your father orders and you start crying.

Still listening to the phone Dean runs out of the house to get to the Impala as fast as possible.

—-

Shaking in fear you sit on the bed. Why did you run away? You could’ve been safe with Dean but now your own father will allow Eldon to hurt you again.

There’s no way out…

Dean was right. Your father is the king of lies and you will have to follow his orders.

—-

“Hello, Dean. What brings you to my house?” Crowley snickers when Dean enters the manor gun in his hand

“You know why I came. I want my wife. Where is she?”

“In her room. You should better leave now. Coming to my house, alone. With a gun in your hands gives me the right to just kill you, Dean.”

“Who says I’m alone? Benny, Cas, and Gadreel are outside. Just like ten of dad’s men. I gave them the order to wait five minutes. If I’m not out of the house with my wife in five then they will come for me and her to make sure I’ll get out safe.” Dean lies.

“Ten…oh…” Knowing all his men are busy preparing the strike against John’s men Crowley turns pale. “Y/N is upstairs. Go and get her, Winchester.”

“Good, boy. Always so submissive.” Dean grunts running upstairs to get you.

—-

When the door to your room swings open you expect your father or Eldon. What you don’t expect is Dean worriedly looking at you.

“We got to go. Now. I lied. I’m alone and Crowley will find out soon. Come.” Dean whispers taking you by the hand.

“Why did you come here? My father…he…”

“You are my wife, I won’t let that scum touch what’s mine. Now let’s get out of this shithole. I’ll bring you home.” Dean whispers leading you out of the room.

“Home…” You whisper. Hours ago, you believed this house is your home.

Walking past your father with Dean by your side your start shaking. Wrapping an arm around your shoulders Dean brings you out of the house. Guiding you toward the Impala he keeps an eye on Crowley.

—-

“You ran away in your pajamas and without shoes?” Dean asks checking on you.

“I was scared. You talked to them and then I heard the laughter. It was the same…they did this to Jess. My father was behind all of this.” You sob.

“Hey. That’s not your fault.” Dean says softly stroking some strands out of your face.

“He let those men kidnap me to punish my mother. She wanted to tell your father about my father’s plans. The marks. He ordered that they shall mark me to remind my mother what will happen next time.”

“What about Sam and Jess?”

“My father wanted to force your dad to agree to the marriage. John was stubborn so dad…he … Jess.”

“Son of a bitch!” Dean yells smashing a lamp against the wall.

“He wants to take over your dads’ business. Kill all of you. As the only remaining Winchester…I…”

“Shit. I got to call dad and Sam. They will come around. Don’t worry. You are safe with me. No one will ever hurt you again.”

“I’m so sorry. I never thought my father would do such a thing. Maybe he even killed my mom?”

“You think so?” Dean asks stroking your cheek.

“I know they were arguing two days before she got killed.”

“Wait here. Take a shower. Don’t worry. Cas and Benny are securing the house. Gadreel and Garth are on their way. I called them while I was driving to your father’s house.”

“You came alone to save me. I’m sorry for running away. What they said…I thought.”

“Look at me. I knew…when he said he knows how you taste…I knew it was him. I wanted to kill him but my gun…”

“Oh…you left it in the nightstand because of me.” Sniffing you let Dean help you get up. Clinging to him you rest your head against his shoulder to let the tears fall. “I can’t believe it was my dad. Tonight, I lost everything I had left of my family.”

“Doesn’t matter. You got a new family. Me and Sam…maybe even John. We won’t let you down.”

“But this marriage was forced.” You whisper.

“I don’t care. I like you no matter what. I risked my life to save you. I…think.” The ringing of the doorbell disturbs the intimate moment.

“Dean…thank you.”

“Take a shower. I’ll handle everything else. I guess Cas already informed dad and Sam. Just breathe Baby…breathe.” Dean whispers and you nod.

—-

“Did you know?” Dean asks looking at John.

“Yes. That’s the reason I refused to let you attack Lucifer. He had nothing to do with this.”

“Why did you never tell me? I mean he forced you to agree to the marriage and give him half of your business after the wedding?”

“He threatened Sam’s life and even worse. I know what happened to Jess but Sam not. He had to watch when she died but he doesn’t know the whole truth. Crowley taped everything. Every minute of her misery. He threatened me to show it to Sammy. I couldn’t let him see it…”

“Dad?” Dean asks.

“He believes that they only did it once. They took turns, Dean. The worst is Jess was pregnant. Please never tell Sam so. It would kill him even more. I had no other choice than agreeing to the contract. It was my fault. I never…I knew Crowley is cruel some but that he would do such a thing to Jess. I swear I would’ve agreed right away.”

“You didn’t want to appear weak. Right, John?” You ask walking into the living room.

“That’s right, Y/N. I’m sorry for my behavior but I thought if I and Dean treat you bad your dad would cut this whole marriage off. I was wrong, just like with Jess.”

“My father is a monster. I guess he killed mom too. She wanted to tell you everything he planned. That’s the reason he kidnapped me…well, let the Styne’s kidnap me.”

“Your mom was…wonderful,” John whispers.

“Wonderful?” You ask.

“She was the first woman after Mary’s death I truly loved. Crowley found out and killed her.”

“You had and affair with my mom?” You gasp.

“When Sam turned eighteen you and your mom came to visit us. We talked for hours and that’s how it began. We started as friends and in the end, we fell in love.”

“Dad?”

“I loved her, Dean. I know it was wrong. She was married but I couldn’t stop myself. I never felt happier since your mom’s death.”

“You never told anybody?” You ask.

“After Crowley found out your mom tried to keep her distance. He hit her and when you turned eighteen she wanted to run away with you…and me. I prepared everything. She wasn’t buying stuff for your birthday party that day. She was trying to get some things from her safe deposit box.”

“But how could he know…”

“Rowena. Your mom, she told her everything. Even that he was behind all this.”

“Rowena knew? She knew…I can’t believe it.” You sob. “I guess when my mom died I lost my whole family. This can’t be true. How could she do this to mom?”

“She’s your father’s mother,” Dean says slinging an arm around your shoulder.

“What do we do know?” You whisper.

“First of all, you two will get more guards. I suggest that you won’t leave the house without Dean or Benny by your side. I’ll tell Cas and Benny to stay here. Five other men will take their positions in the house across the street.” John says.

“What about Sammy?” Dean asks.

“I told him about the situation. That Crowley was behind the kidnapping…I can’t tell him about Jess. This would kill him. He will stay with Bobby and Jody at the Mansion.”

“What about you John? My father is after you too.”

“Worried about me? That’s cute. I’m too stubborn to die. I’ll coordinate the security and call our allies from outside.” John explains and Dean nods.

“Lucifer and Michael?” Dean asks.

“Exactly. I know you don’t like both, but they were always reliable. You will stay here and protect her. She’s your responsibility.”

“No Sir!” Dean protests and your heart sinks.

“She ain’t my responsibility…she’s my wife and I’ll protect her.”

With shaking hands, you dial Dean’s number to tell him…well everything.

“Y/N? Where are you? What happened?” Dean asks worriedly.

“Just listen. I’m so sorry. The Styne’s I recognized the laughter. They are the kidnappers. It’s not John…it’s my father. He…oh god… I’m so sorry. He was it all the time. My father said he wants to kill John and you to get hold of the business. He wants me to marry Eldon. Tell Sammy I’m so sorry. Crowley did all of this to force your dad to agree to the marriage. I was wrong…so wrong. Please forgive me…I’m…I never hated you, Dean…I liked you…I want you to be happy.” Hearing your father walking toward your room you start crying.

“I hope you can forgive me one day…” You sob.

“Where are you?” Dean asks.

“Home…my room.” You whisper before hiding the phone under your bed sheets.

“You should rest now, daughter. Tomorrow you will meet Eldon to show you can be a good wife to him.” Your father orders and you start crying.

Still listening to the phone Dean runs out of the house to get to the Impala as fast as possible.

—-

Shaking in fear you sit on the bed. Why did you run away? You could’ve been safe with Dean but now your own father will allow Eldon to hurt you again.

There’s no way out…

Dean was right. Your father is the king of lies and you will have to follow his orders.

—-

“You know why I came. I want my wife. Where is she?”

“In her room. You should better leave now. Coming to my house, alone. With a gun in your hands gives me the right to just kill you, Dean.”

“Who says I’m alone? Benny, Cas, and Gadreel are outside. Just like ten of dad’s men. I gave them the order to wait five minutes. If I’m not out of the house with my wife in five then they will come for me and her to make sure I’ll get out safe.” Dean lies.

“Ten…oh…” Knowing all his men are busy preparing the strike against John’s men Crowley turns pale. “Y/N is upstairs. Go and get her, Winchester.”

“Good, boy. Always so submissive.” Dean grunts running upstairs to get you.

—-

When the door to your room swings open you expect your father or Eldon. What you don’t expect is Dean worriedly looking at you.

“We got to go. Now. I lied. I’m alone and Crowley will find out soon. Come.” Dean whispers taking you by the hand.

“Why did you come here? My father…he…”

“You are my wife, I won’t let that scum touch what’s mine. Now let’s get out of this shithole. I’ll bring you home.” Dean whispers leading you out of the room.

“Home…” You whisper. Hours ago, you believed this house is your home.

Walking past your father with Dean by your side your start shaking. Wrapping an arm around your shoulders Dean brings you out of the house. Guiding you toward the Impala he keeps an eye on Crowley.

—-

“You ran away in your pajamas and without shoes?” Dean asks checking on you.

“I was scared. You talked to them and then I heard the laughter. It was the same…they did this to Jess. My father was behind all of this.” You sob.

“Hey. That’s not your fault.” Dean says softly stroking some strands out of your face.

“He let those men kidnap me to punish my mother. She wanted to tell your father about my father’s plans. The marks. He ordered that they shall mark me to remind my mother what will happen next time.”

“What about Sam and Jess?”

“My father wanted to force your dad to agree to the marriage. John was stubborn so dad…he … Jess.”

“Son of a bitch!” Dean yells smashing a lamp against the wall.

“He wants to take over your dads’ business. Kill all of you. As the only remaining Winchester…I…”

“Shit. I got to call dad and Sam. They will come around. Don’t worry. You are safe with me. No one will ever hurt you again.”

“I’m so sorry. I never thought my father would do such a thing. Maybe he even killed my mom?”

“You think so?” Dean asks stroking your cheek.

“I know they were arguing two days before she got killed.”

“Wait here. Take a shower. Don’t worry. Cas and Benny are securing the house. Gadreel and Garth are on their way. I called them while I was driving to your father’s house.”

“You came alone to save me. I’m sorry for running away. What they said…I thought.”

“Look at me. I knew…when he said he knows how you taste…I knew it was him. I wanted to kill him but my gun…”

“Oh…you left it in the nightstand because of me.” Sniffing you let Dean help you get up. Clinging to him you rest your head against his shoulder to let the tears fall. “I can’t believe it was my dad. Tonight, I lost everything I had left of my family.”

“Doesn’t matter. You got a new family. Me and Sam…maybe even John. We won’t let you down.”

“But this marriage was forced.” You whisper.

“I don’t care. I like you no matter what. I risked my life to save you. I…think.” The ringing of the doorbell disturbs the intimate moment.

“Dean…thank you.”

“Take a shower. I’ll handle everything else. I guess Cas already informed dad and Sam. Just breathe Baby…breathe.” Dean whispers and you nod.

—-

“Did you know?” Dean asks looking at John.

“Yes. That’s the reason I refused to let you attack Lucifer. He had nothing to do with this.”

“Why did you never tell me? I mean he forced you to agree to the marriage and give him half of your business after the wedding?”

“He threatened Sam’s life and even worse. I know what happened to Jess but Sam not. He had to watch when she died but he doesn’t know the whole truth. Crowley taped everything. Every minute of her misery. He threatened me to show it to Sammy. I couldn’t let him see it…”

“Dad?” Dean asks.

“He believes that they only did it once. They took turns, Dean. The worst is Jess was pregnant. Please never tell Sam so. It would kill him even more. I had no other choice than agreeing to the contract. It was my fault. I never…I knew Crowley is cruel some but that he would do such a thing to Jess. I swear I would’ve agreed right away.”

“You didn’t want to appear weak. Right, John?” You ask walking into the living room.

“That’s right, Y/N. I’m sorry for my behavior but I thought if I and Dean treat you bad your dad would cut this whole marriage off. I was wrong, just like with Jess.”

“My father is a monster. I guess he killed mom too. She wanted to tell you everything he planned. That’s the reason he kidnapped me…well, let the Styne’s kidnap me.”

“Your mom was…wonderful,” John whispers.

“Wonderful?” You ask.

“She was the first woman after Mary’s death I truly loved. Crowley found out and killed her.”

“You had and affair with my mom?” You gasp.

“When Sam turned eighteen you and your mom came to visit us. We talked for hours and that’s how it began. We started as friends and in the end, we fell in love.”

“Dad?”

“I loved her, Dean. I know it was wrong. She was married but I couldn’t stop myself. I never felt happier since your mom’s death.”

“You never told anybody?” You ask.

“After Crowley found out your mom tried to keep her distance. He hit her and when you turned eighteen she wanted to run away with you…and me. I prepared everything. She wasn’t buying stuff for your birthday party that day. She was trying to get some things from her safe deposit box.”

“But how could he know…”

“Rowena. Your mom, she told her everything. Even that he was behind all this.”

“Rowena knew? She knew…I can’t believe it.” You sob. “I guess when my mom died I lost my whole family. This can’t be true. How could she do this to mom?”

“She’s your father’s mother,” Dean says slinging an arm around your shoulder.

“What do we do know?” You whisper.

“First of all, you two will get more guards. I suggest that you won’t leave the house without Dean or Benny by your side. I’ll tell Cas and Benny to stay here. Five other men will take their positions in the house across the street.” John says.

“What about Sammy?” Dean asks.

“I told him about the situation. That Crowley was behind the kidnapping…I can’t tell him about Jess. This would kill him. He will stay with Bobby and Jody at the Mansion.”

“What about you John? My father is after you too.”

“Worried about me? That’s cute. I’m too stubborn to die. I’ll coordinate the security and call our allies from outside.” John explains and Dean nods.

“Lucifer and Michael?” Dean asks.

“Exactly. I know you don’t like both, but they were always reliable. You will stay here and protect her. She’s your responsibility.”

“No Sir!” Dean protests and your heart sinks.

“She ain’t my responsibility…she’s my wife and I’ll protect her.”

summary: Good Omens review: Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman’s whimsical book brought to life
title: Good Omens review: Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman’s whimsical book brought to life
excerpt: Michael Sheen and David Tennant anchor the premiere episode as the central angel and demon duo
description:
This is quite a…. strange review in my opinion.

* “the melancholy tone may not be for everyone” MELANCHOLY. What??

* “Both actors [Tennant and Sheen] fully commit to their roles, gamely wearing multiple silly costumes.” pffffffFFT I don’t know what this means but I for sure want to see what the opposite looks like. would they reluctantly wear their costumes? or would they just be naked?

* “Tennant’s portrayal of the reluctantly evil, sunglass-wearing demon is reminiscent of Bill Nighy in Love Actually” OH NO OH NO OH NO CAN’T UNSEE

summary: David Tennant explains why it was "hugely important" to get Good Omens right for TV
title: David Tennant explains why it was "hugely important" to get Good Omens right for TV
excerpt: It's an adaptation almost 30 years in the making.
description:
“For someone who’s eternal, he does actually kind of change as the piece goes on,” Sheen says. “He starts out being slightly holier-than-thou – what we have as an idea of a boring goody-goody two-shoes or whatever – but actually it becomes something different over time.”

“He’s an angel who is not without his flashes of naughtiness, and I’m a demon who has been known to do the right thing occasionally,” Tennant says. “They’re best friends, but they could never admit that. But they do rely on each other, and they become each other’s touchstone through the ages.”

“Even though they’re opposite teams, Aziraphale’s nature is to love, so he just loves Crowley,” adds Sheen. “Maybe he’s a little bit in love with Crowley. Or maybe that’s just me and David!”

“Even though they’re opposite teams, Aziraphale’s nature is to love, so he just loves Crowley,” adds Sheen. “Maybe he’s a little bit in love with Crowley. Or maybe that’s just me and David!”

“For someone who’s eternal, he does actually kind of change as the piece goes on,” Sheen says. “He starts out being slightly holier-than-thou – what we have as an idea of a boring goody-goody two-shoes or whatever – but actually it becomes something different over time.”

“He’s an angel who is not without his flashes of naughtiness, and I’m a demon who has been known to do the right thing occasionally,” Tennant says. “They’re best friends, but they could never admit that. But they do rely on each other, and they become each other’s touchstone through the ages.”

“Even though they’re opposite teams, Aziraphale’s nature is to love, so he just loves Crowley,” adds Sheen. “Maybe he’s a little bit in love with Crowley. Or maybe that’s just me and David!”
trail.content:
“For someone who’s eternal, he does actually kind of change as the piece goes on,” Sheen says. “He starts out being slightly holier-than-thou – what we have as an idea of a boring goody-goody two-shoes or whatever – but actually it becomes something different over time.”

“He’s an angel who is not without his flashes of naughtiness, and I’m a demon who has been known to do the right thing occasionally,” Tennant says. “They’re best friends, but they could never admit that. But they do rely on each other, and they become each other’s touchstone through the ages.”
